top_comment.text:
Ложка паноса Гебельса в мозгах у некоторых Резунов.

Про бред Тухачевского - грезившего о 11 миллионной армии в мирный тогда 
период о безумном количестве танков и превентивным ударам - так его за 
такой бред вроде к стенки и поставили (побоялись что он своим троцкиским 
бредом власть захватит и странну раззорит в конец). Так что всякие Резуны с 
Гебельсами могут поносом мозга исходить о агрессивных планах СССР - но это 
было бредом полным, как и прожекты Тухачевских всяких.

А колеса на танке по двум причинам - в 30е годы небыло танковых тягачей - 
танки ездили сами. Ресурс гусениц тех лет был низкий - калеса тупо 
экономили бабки в стране где индустриализация была в зачатке и в газетах.﻿

captions.text:
I.Z. - Hero-cities! Just listen to these words!
This honorary title was awarded to twelve

cities in the Soviet Union. The cities are
known because of their heroic defense during

the Great Patriotic War. And in one of them
I came.

The city of Minsk at the beginning of the
war was one of the first major cities which

has taken the brunt of the German army. The
enemy entered the city June 28, 1941. But

before the entering, the Nazi Germany had
tasted the charm of Soviet weapon during the

battle of Belostok-Minsk. Those fights we
unfortunately lost, but the courage of our

ancestors will not be forgotten. And one such
memorable place is Minsk fortification district.

Today at the battlefield there is a museum
of military glory, the open-air museum "Stalin's
Line".

I.Z. - Yeah ... impressive! Looks like it
was made with the soul and the state scale...

But I came here not to admire the landscapes,
although they are very beautiful...

I came here for the only one alive in the
former Soviet Union, and perhaps in the world
... it does not matter .. for the tank.

I.Z. -- Blah, blah, blah... Hello and so
on.

I.Z. - BT-7. "Fast Tank". Well. Where normally
starts running of the fighting machine?

(IF PETROLEUM) Tank's engine even now amazes
it's figures: carburetor M-seventeen T has

a twelve cylinders and the volume of ... liters.
It produces four hundred horsepower. By the

way, this engine came in tank industry from
the aircraft. The completions were done a

little, and for turnover reducing and increasing
the resource on the carburetor, it had been

decided just to decrease the size of nozzles
and diffusers.

(IF DIESEL) Tank's engine even now amazes
it's figures: diesel V 12 with volume about

39,000 cc and declared output of 5 hundred
horsepower water-cooled. With a maximum torque

of 1 thousand 9 hundred 60 Newtons on meter
at 1200 rounds per minute. By the way, the

B-2 was the first in the history of the diesel
engine, specially constructed as a tank engine,

and at that time it was the world's most powerful
tank engine.

But let's get back to the history. The panzer
BT-7 started serial producing in early 1935

at "Comintern's Kharkov Locomotive plant".
Even from the modern point of view the machine

is not ordinary, as it had a wheel-track mover.
What does it mean. On asphalt BT rides on

wheels and reaches seventy two km per hour,
but at the cross-country it uses tracks. Even

then, the decision was controversial, but
from the economic and strategic point of view

it was fully rational. Track resource does
not exceed 1 thousand kilometers, so if you

move under its own power to the place of battle,
and even on the highway it was possible to

lost the tracks. Moreover Army also had a
deficit of tracks at all. But despite of the...

I.Z. -- And now I might disappoint many people...
The story about the fact that at the beginning

of the war, German tanks were better and our
tanks were outdated, it's bullshit! BT-7 at

that time was the best tank in its class.
Do not believe me? Conduct an independent
comparative analysis...

In the turret there are two members of the
crew: commander, he's gun-layer and loader.

Armament of the tank, it's forty five millimeters
gun 20K model 1934 and machine gun DT with

7.62- millimeters caliber. Allowance of ammunition
- 172 shots for the cannon and about 2 thousand
bullets for machine gun.

I.Z. -- It definitely can be called ... the
front door! First time in my life it is comfortable

enough in the tank. By the way, here at the
right there is wheel to control the tank when

it is on wheels.
The body of this BT assembled from armor and

steel plates and it is a box-like structure
with dual side walls. The frontal armor is

20 mm, 13 mm turret, the shell's bort is 13
mm. It not significantly, but conceded to

the German tanks. But the speed! But a little
bit later.
I.Z. -- Well, slowly starting...

During the movement the whole body feels as
machine is rushing forward, pushing you to

overclock the fourteen-ton tank to a maximum
of 52 km per hours on tracks! BUT! To switch

the 4-speed gearbox in motion, you have to
be a virtuoso and the do feel the machine.

Unfortunately, I'm is still far from perfection,
and as many tankers at the beginning of the
war, I had to stop.

I.Z. -- And also, to turn this machine, this
actually lightweight machine, it is necessary

to pull the lever on which the force is about
forty kilograms. And I'm... a little bit tired.

But the machine just creeps if simplify it's
handling, the tank can be safely compared

to the good motor car. But all this is from
today's point of view, but that time there

was no choice and our grandfathers and great-grandfathers
on such machines took part in the Battle of

Moscow, at Stalingrad, crushed the enemy in
the North Caucasus. And a swansong of the

BT-7 became the redeployment through the Big
Hing in August 1945 and participation in the
defeat of the Japanese Kwantung Army.

I.Z. -- Reading books, playing computer simulations,
look at the pictures ... all this is great.

But, if you haven't touched it, haven't seen
with your own eyes ....You cannot understand

the beauty of a severe iron. Visit museums,
learn the history and love your motherland.

We have much to be proud of! Well, but I go
to the hunt again...
